short_description: Control over one's body and the ability to move elegantly
long_description: Acrobatics describes the ability to control one's body. It encompasses moving elegantly, gymnastics, breaking falls and dancing.

short_description: Interaction with animals; calming them down, taming and training them
long_description: Animal Handling is any interaction with animals; calming them down, taming and training them.

short_description: Any attempt to charm or convince someone that at least outwardly happens in good blood
long_description: Appeal encompasses any attempt to charm or convince someone that at least outwardly happens in good blood.

short_description: Lifting, pushing, running, jumping; anything built on directed strength
long_description: Athletics is used for any task built on directing one's strength, be it lifting, pushing, running or jumping.

short_description: Making alcoholic beverages
long_description: Making any sort of alcoholic beverage is considered brewing. All differences between creating beer, wine and whatever else is neglected.

short_description: Identifying or creating chemicals; includes knowledge of recipies and estimation of effects and sideeffects
long_description: Chemistry is necessary for identifying and creating chemicals. It also includes knowledge of recipies and estimation of effects and sideeffects for unknown recipies

short_description: Scaling heights
long_description: Climbing generally means scaling heights. Holding oneself at the ceiling might be considered climbing as well.

short_description: Military social interaction, usually featuring a clear hierarchy
long_description: Command describes military social interactions that feature a clear hierarchy. It also represents knowledge about military leadership and command structure.

short_description: Trading and bribery
long_description: Anything concerned with the exchange of money falls under the Commerce skill. This obviously includes trading but also bribery and extortion.

short_description: Using computers and computer-like interfaces to their fullest
long_description: Computer Operation means using a computer. That technically includes even the simplest tasks but only advanced operations will require a test, such as getting access to files that one should not have access to.

short_description: Creating buildings and other larger structures
long_description: Construction is concerned with creating buildings and understanding buildings; that means probable layouts or weaknesses.

short_description: Knowledge about en- and decrypting texts and other data
long_description: Crytography is the knowledge about en- and decyphering data of any type. If the data was human-readable, a cunning character might identify simple probable cypher algorithms.

short_description: Telling lies
long_description: Deceiving means telling lies. Making half-truths believable might fall under this skill as well, as per GM discretion.

short_description: Evading attacks by moving out of the way
long_description: Dodging is physically evading harm. This can be an attack or something more natural like falling objects or sudden vehicles.

short_description: Operating a bike or similar vehicle
long_description: Drive (Bike) encompasses the knowledge of how motorbikes and similar vehicles work and how to get them to move in a desired direction.

short_description: Operating a boat or similar vehicle
long_description: Drive (Boat) encompasses the knowledge of how motorboats and similar vehicles work and how to get them to move in a desired direction. Rowboats, canoos and so on might be covered with athletics instead.

short_description: Operating a car or similar vehicle
long_description: Drive (Car) encompasses the knowledge of how cars and similar vehicles work and how to get them to move in a desired direction.

short_description: Operating a truck, tank or similar vehicle
long_description: Drive (Heavy) encompasses the knowledge of how trucks and similar vehicles work and how to get them to move in a desired direction. It also includes knowledge about APCs, IFVs or tanks and other heavy armored vehicles.

short_description: The ability to estimate amounts, weight, size, distance and whatever else might come up; a smith estimating a knife's price might not necessarily need this
long_description: Estimation is the ability to guess amounts, weight, size, distance and whatever else might come up; a smith estimating a knife's price might not necessarily need this.

short_description: Bets, card and board games
long_description: Gambling is betting, card and board games: knowing how to play, knowing how to win, by all means if necessary.

short_description: Knowledge of places
long_description: Geography describes the knowledge of the world and its places.

short_description: Knowledge about plants
long_description: Herbalism is knowledge of plants, formal or by experience.

short_description: Knowledge about the past
long_description: History is the knowledge of past events. Low values don't necessarily mean no knowledge but might include false information as well.

short_description: Asking the right questions as well as reading facial expressions and voice tone to determine truth or lie; also includes understanding the opposition
long_description: Interrogation encompasses asking the right questions as well as reading facial expressions and voice tone to determine truth or lie; also includes understanding the opposition's true meaning.

short_description: Threatening others to avoid actually having to go through with the threat
long_description: Intimidation means skillfully threatening others to avoid actually having to go through with the threat.

short_description: Knowledge about law and the ability to accuse and defend properly
long_description: Law means the knowledge about rights and also the ability to accuse and defend properly.

short_description: Combine knowledge and work with patterns
long_description: Logic is the ability to dissect and combine information rationally and quickly or detect patterns where others do not.

short_description: Knowledge about more advanced technology and how to repair or even create it
long_description: Mechanics encompasses the knowledge of how technology works and the skill to fix or even create it.

short_description: Knowledge about anatomy and healing of biological bodies
long_description: Medication is the necessary knowledge of anatomy and medical chemicals and the skill of how to apply it, give first aid and do surgery.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Grappling is unarmed or assisted close quarters combat that mainly acts to change positions in combat, be that throwing the enemy on the floor, a table or off a balcony, climbing a very large foe or getting the enemy into a lock.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Knife fighting involves short, bladed and pointy implements. These can be proper combat knives or improvised weapons like kitchen knives or shards of glass.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Clubs are any and all blunt weapons with some sort of shaft: hammers, maces, the humble stick.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Striking is the unarmed discipline concerned with short, fast body contact to induce blunt force trauma, be that punches, knees, kicks or headbutts. This may be assisted using fist knives or brass knuckles.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Much like knives swords are bladed, generally pointy implements, only longer. This grants an advantage in reach and damage potential, but is less suitable for swinging in close quarters.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
Skill with a certain group of melee weapons
long_description: Whips as a category encompass every weapon that flexes: actual whips and crops, but also flails and nunchucks, even though those weapons have drastically different fighting styles.

short_description: Finding one's way in a certain environment
long_description: Navigation in the air is difficult and relies on good sense of both distance and direction. It may be easier when sun, moon, stars or large landmarks on the ground are visible.

short_description: Finding one's way in a certain environment
long_description: Navigation on the ground is the most common type of navigation. It helps finding one's way on foot or in earthbound vehicles.

short_description: Finding one's way in a certain environment
long_description: Navigation on the sea relies on reading maps and a compass. It is possible to make good educated guesses by using celestial bodies as well.

short_description: Finding one's way in a certain environment
long_description: Navigation through the void of space without equipment is almost impossible due to how vast space is. This skill represents finding the shortest and safest path given such instruments.

short_description: Finding one's way in a certain environment
long_description: Navigating through underground complexes is quite difficult, as there are very few landmarks. It requires good memory or a map and good sense of distance.

short_description: Perceiving things and noticing details
long_description: Perception is essential for noticing small details. Someone properly educated with trained sense of hearing for example might make out the type of gun or ammunition used in a shot from the sound alone.

short_description: What can truly be known?
long_description: Philosophy is what drives many people in the shadows of neon lights. Existential questions rarely find clear answers but one might come close.

short_description: Operating a flying vehicle
long_description: Piloting aircraft means understanding basics of aerodynamics and controls of different aircraft, usually but not necessarily it also encompasses basic understanding of flight control procedures.

short_description: Operating jump- and jetpacks
long_description: While not piloting in the classical sense, using jetpacks effectively is an extremely difficult discipline of aeronautica.

short_description: Operating spacecraft
long_description: Piloting spacecraft does not happen alone but this skill is representative of any position spacecraft may have.

short_description: Drinking to your heart's desire
long_description: Quaffing, getting wrecked, hammered, tanked, any of the above. This determines a character's ability to hold his liquor.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Bows require a flexing shaft and a string which is pulled using one's back muscle and, when released, will shoot an element at whatever it was pointed at. Even with pulley systems it requires a lot of physical fitness.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Explosive launchers encompass rocket and grenade launchers, mortars and anything else that propels large high-explosives at an enemy. This also helps estimate explosion radii and colleteral damages.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Launchers throw large, usually explosive projectiles at an enemy. They are decently heavy and generally require a specialized soldier.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Long rifles are anything firing high-power charges accurately over great distances. Long barrels, scopes and bipods can make these weapons cumbersome for everyday life.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Pistols are easily conceilable, fire low-power charges and, if absolutely necessary, can be fired with one hand.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Short rifles is a catchall term for anything that is not cumbersome like a long rifle but not as small and low-powered that it is very easily conceilable or able to be fired with one hand. This includes small shotguns, submachineguns and short barrel rifles.

short_description: Skill with a certain group of ranged weapons
long_description: Throwing objects is the easiest way to get a range advantage over an opponent. This includes throwing knives, shuriken and the humble stone among others.

short_description: The ability to push through pain and strong emotions
long_description: Restraint is the ability to push through and ignore both pain and strong emotions. Trying to suppress disabling characteristics is at a penalty equal to the disabling characteristic.

short_description: Setting and defusing traps, as well as knowledge of tactics
long_description: Security encompasses anything that is involved in defense: Personally setting and defusing traps, tactical choice of location, how to employ chokepoints and the exploitation of any mistakes the opposition might have made.

short_description: Card tricks, pickpocketing, lockpicking; anything requiring both delicate fingers as well as good distractions
long_description: Sleight of hand covers everything that requires delicate fingers and a good distraction. This may be pickpocketing or card tricks or whatever someone might come up with. Picking locks is part of this skill as well.

short_description: Creating objects from metal
long_description: Smithing is the creation of new objects from metal. Casting also falls under this skill, even though it is not technically smithing.

short_description: Hiding things or oneself
long_description: Stealth describes the ability to hide, be it oneself or objects, as well as moving quietly. It is usually heavily modified and often opposed with Perception.

short_description: Either the knowledge of or the ability to make up stories and tell them in interesting fashion
long_description: Stories means the knowledge of stories, the ability to make them up on the spot and the capability to tell them interestingly.

short_description: Finding food, building shelter and the most basic, improvised equipment
long_description: Survival is a catchall skill encompassing anything required for wilderness or wasteland survival: finding something edible and clean water, building improvised shelters and the most basic equipment.

short_description: Crossing through waters without drowning
long_description: Swimming is the capacity to cross through waters without drowning. Due to how rare open bodies of water are, this skill is surprisingly rare.

short_description: Creating objects from cloth
long_description: Tailoring is the knowledge of how to make objects from cloth or leathers. Very few people still do this themselves and their works are revered and sold for high prices.

short_description: Finding and following a trail
long_description: Tracking means finding and following a trail. This might be footprints of some wild animal or disturbances left by fleeing suspects.

short_description: Singing, vocal impersonation
long_description: Voice athletes are capable of changing their voices to sound a certain way. This can be used for ventriloquism, impersonation or something as simple as singing.

short_description: Knowledge about animals
long_description: Zoology is knowledge about animals. This may be from formal education or experience and can sometimes be restricted when dealing with rare or exoctic animals.
